docs.snippet: The League of Nations treaty convention restricting the manufacture of narcotic drugs went into effect around the world yesterday. In New York the World Narcotic Defense Association celebrated with, speeches and a radio broadcast from the Hotel...
docs.lead_paragraph: The League of Nations treaty convention restricting the manufacture of narcotic drugs went into effect around the world yesterday. In New York the World Narcotic Defense Association celebrated with, speeches and a radio broadcast from the Hotel Waldorf-Astoria.
docs.abstract: Treaty goes into effect; celebration in N Y C; history of treaty; hailed by Roosevelt

headline.main: NARCOTICS TREATY GOES INTO EFFECT; World Compact to Restrict Production to Legitimate Needs Is Hailed Here. FIRST OBJECTIVE GAINED A 'Wonderful Achievement,' Says Roosevelt -- Hobson Urges New State Laws.

docs.snippet: Generally improved conditions in credits and collections are reported by exporters shipping merchandise to Latin-American countries, the foreign Credit Interchange Bureau of the National Association of Credit Men reported yesterday. Completing their...
docs.lead_paragraph: Generally improved conditions in credits and collections are reported by exporters shipping merchandise to Latin-American countries, the foreign Credit Interchange Bureau of the National Association of Credit Men reported yesterday. Completing their nineteenth quarterly survey of the twenty-one South and Central American markets, the credit bureau reported that the upward trend in credits and collections which started early this year has continued.
docs.abstract: Foreign Credit Interchange Bur rept on credit and collections in Latin Amer

headline.main: CREDIT UPTURN HOLDS IN SOUTH AMERICA; Survey Also Discloses Steady Rise in Export Collections in Second Quarter.

docs.snippet: Prices of bonds rocketed yesterday on the Stock Exchange, many foreign and domestic issues gaining 1 to 9 points on the day and establishing new high quotations for the year to date. THE NEW YORK TIMES averages for foreign loans and domestic...
docs.lead_paragraph: Prices of bonds rocketed yesterday on the Stock Exchange, many foreign and domestic issues gaining 1 to 9 points on the day and establishing new high quotations for the year to date. THE NEW YORK TIMES averages for foreign loans and domestic railroad, industrial and utility bonds touched new peaks for 1933.

headline.main: BOND PRICES CLIMB AS TRADING DROPS; Foreign and Domestic Issues on Stock Exchange Reach Many New Peaks for 1933. LATIN-AMERICAN LOANS UP German, French and Japanese Groups Strong -- Movement Upward on the Curb.

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, July 18. -- President Justo accepted today the resignation of Finance Minister Alberto Hueyo, who has opposed ratification of the new commercial treaty with Britain.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, July 18. -- President Justo accepted today the resignation of Finance Minister Alberto Hueyo, who has opposed ratification of the new commercial treaty with Britain.

headline.main: ARGENTINE CABINET SPLIT ON INFLATION; Opposition to British Trade Pact Also Plays Part in Resignation of Hueyo. MORATORIUM IS DEMANDED Retiring Finance Minister Had Stood Firmly Against Halt on the Foreign Debt.

byline.original: By JOHN W. WHITE.Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, July 18. --The hopes of officials here for a new Pan-American trade alliance were increased today by unofficial reports from Buenos Aires indicating that strong opposition to the intended Anglo-Argentine trade pact had arisen in...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, July 18. --The hopes of officials here for a new Pan-American trade alliance were increased today by unofficial reports from Buenos Aires indicating that strong opposition to the intended Anglo-Argentine trade pact had arisen in Argentina.

headline.main: MORE STATES ASK ACCORDS WITH US; Chile and Uruguay Would Join in the Negotiations for Commercial Alliances.
